page.title: 10TRANSPORT IN S.E.LUTON
page.content: The area is extremely lucky to have good links with the rest of the country. {ROAD.}The M.1.motorway runs just to the west of Luton and the town is served by two junctions.There are good long distance coach connections . {RAIL.}The bus and railway stations are connected.Luton has good main line links with the Midlands and London St. Pancras.There are 22 trains each day on the newly electrified line to London and the cheapest return = Â£4.80 {AIR.}Luton International Airport is owned and run by the Borough Council. It was opened in 1938 and has grown to the point where it is the 5th largest in Britain with 2m. passengers each year.Much of the traffic involves holiday flights to Europe and N.Africa New terminal buildings are underway and the govt.has announced more growth
